messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

not enough space on the drive for windows upgrade re enough space drive hello please attached capture seems be taking up lot space had deeper look but what can delete there anyone can talk for advice thank you manager sent wednesday re enough space drive hello please install tool tools desktop your partition order contents size folders your partition if you get similar requests users please advise them install tool drive contents their drives clear disk space please let know whether any further information needed best regards senior engineer en sent wednesday re enough space drive hello did you have take look thanks manager sent monday enough space drive hello friday evening wanted perform upgrade but seems have enough free space drive had look cleaned up some items but still have enough free space only free space can tell what taking up space drive would you be able assist with thank you manager

message.reasoning:
**Determining Ticket Category**

I'm zeroing in on the best category for this ticket. The constant mention of "not enough space on the drive" strongly indicates a "Storage" issue. I need to make sure this is the *only* relevant facet for the ticket's category.


**Analyzing Evidence for Category**

I've got the category locked down. The user's repeated emphasis on "drive space" is solid evidence for "Storage." All the ticket text indicates a disk space problem. It feels pretty cut and dry. Now, it's just a matter of ensuring the categorization reflects that.
